pros: Feels like family Understanding Great Pay
cons: High Turnover Hospice is difficult work

job_title: Business Development Representative in Columbus, IN
pros: People often describe Our Hospice staff as "angles" and I feel the same way. The care and compassion given by our care team to patients and their family members is amazing and I receive that same amazing feeling as a co-worker. I always feel comfortable asking questions and I am never made to feel uneducated. We say what we do and we do what we say and that takes trust from administrative staff to clinical staff.
cons: I am committed to my job and will work when needed, at times that means evening, weekends, and holidays. We have a limited number of paid holidays, as we serve patients based on their timeline and needs not ours.

pros: Family oriented, mission focused, leadership is supportive
Supportive and encouraging people to work with.
Everyone is so welcoming and the organization lives and breathes by it's mission, "To Make Every Moment Count". This is an incredible non-profit company to work for.
cons: It could be difficult on some days when dealing with families and patients who are suffering .

job_title: RN Case Manager in Columbus, IN
pros: Benefits and compensation are extremely competitive in the market. Work life balance is very fair.
cons: Leadership is poor with new leadership disengaged and unaware of the day to day.

pros: Great network, customer service, caring professionals
